column5: since my old man is working tomorrow i have no other way to tow my boat to hit the river..  so i was thinking of doing some sweet shore fishing somewhere..  its also family fish weekend so i was hoping somewhere maybe a lil remote so there aren't too many people around..   on a side note: is there anyone on the board who uses float tubes or pontoon boats? i'm thinking of gettin one and it'd be col to get a group of guys together and fish outta them
Try a spot close to the water!
Pier 4 (where the boat ramps are) might be busy but may be worthwhile as I think there's some sort of perch derby running.

thanks for the advice. goodluck with the poop smell.    ya bills bait and tackle is having a derby or something..... i've never really fished down there mostly because i dont wanna catch kife hammer handles or carp or anything..  i might hit the upper grand for some smallies or something
Take losta pics so we can see who smells like what eh?
was thinkin of hittin the grand somewhere along #54 looking for nice structure to fish smallies
try binbrook conservation area
Tons of Crappie in Binbrook
do i need a boat?

Pssssst, there's a ton of bass down there.  I live around the block and just walking the dog with glasses you can see a ton sunning themselves in the afternoon.  Don't tell anybody though okay, just between us.
Why would you need a boat to go shore fishing???

ended up going to binbrook. fished from teh boat ramp area  landed about 15 8-10 inch crappie, and kept 3 big ones for dinner. tasted nice and fresh  also landed 2 catfish.  on the way home i stopped off at a pond on the side of the road  caught about 6 LMB, not too big.. but about 12-14 inches maybe. considering the pond is chemical treated i think.  i was hoping for a toxic mutant bass
looks like you had a good day
i definetly wanna get back in there with a float tube or pontoon
Hmmmmm maybe I can borrow a canoe and we can slay em!....  thoughts?  G
Whats up with the "Micropterus hole" moniker???  Tired of being a b  hole?

i have a canoe here, 16 foot springbok aluminum..i just can't put it on my car.. dont wanna scratch my lease   i'm always down for a fishing partner. i'm usually out going han solo..   no idea. ask the admin
Do not need to worry if I throw it in the back of my truck  no paint to scratch back there...  I assume you're in hamilton or area?  G
ya man hamilton mountain. paramount and winterberry area  i say we hook up sometime this week.. maybe on saturday for some crappies  do u have an electric motor?

Mountain here too! Fennel and U. Wellington area  This saturday I am heading north... Lakair here we come!  I do have an electric.. but it is a bow mount.. and not suitable for a canoe..  Drop me a PM... we'll figure something out!  G
You Hammy guys are to close to the smoke.LOL
you got PM  we'll hook up for sure...  fill a bucket of crappie.. that would be sweet  i'm gonna go out there saturday for sure probably
I have a float tube. Lots of fun to use, though I've barely used it since I rarely fish alone.
